repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
By adding a critical section. Also replace a PyList_GET_ITEM.

All the other uses of PyDict_Next look to be handling function arguments (when they should have their own copy of the dict) and thus don't need changing.

comment_data.body: The diff looks much much worse than it is. All I did was pick out the contents of the `source_is_dict` block into a separation function, and then call that function inside a critical section....
...And then add this `GetItemRef` for the list case.

```suggestion
#if PY_VERSION_HEX >= 0x030d0000
        Py_BEGIN_CRITICAL_SECTION(iter_obj);
#endif
        result = __Pyx_dict_iter_next_source_is_dict(iter_obj, orig_length, ppos, pkey, pvalue, pitem);
#if PY_VERSION_HEX >= 0x030d0000
```

commit.message:
Add thread safety around PyDict_Next

By adding a critical section. Also replace a PyList_GET_ITEM.

All the other uses of PyDict_Next look to be handling function
arguments (when they should have their own copy of the dict) and
thus don't need changing.
